suppressedMessages.message:
Error: Calling setState synchronously within an effect can trigger cascading renders

Effects are intended to synchronize state between React and external systems such as manually updating the DOM, state management libraries, or other platform APIs. In general, the body of an effect should do one or both of the following:
* Update external systems with the latest state from React.
* Subscribe for updates from some external system, calling setState in a callback function when external state changes.

Calling setState synchronously within an effect body causes cascading renders that can hurt performance, and is not recommended. (https://react.dev/learn/you-might-not-need-an-effect).

C:\Users\silve\Downloads\GitHub\roadtrip-planner\src\components\Map\AnimatedPolyline.tsx:34:5
  32 |     // React 18+ batches these synchronous setState calls in effects — no cascading renders.
  33 |     // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/set-state-in-effect
> 34 |     setVisiblePositions([]);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Avoid calling setState() directly within an effect
  35 |     setIsAnimating(true);
  36 |
  37 |     const totalPoints = validPositions.length;

messages.message: React Hook useEffect has a missing dependency: 'fuelCostPerKm'. Either include it or remove the dependency array.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [origin, budget, days, travelers, preferences, accommodationType, isRoundTrip, fuelCostPerKm]

fix.text: [origin, budget, days, travelers, preferences, accommodationType, isRoundTrip, fuelCostPerKm]

suppressedMessages.message: 'type' is assigned a value but never used. Allowed unused vars must match /^_/u.
'isFavorite' is assigned a value but never used. Allowed unused vars must match /^_/u.

suppressions.justification: synchronous reset on dialog close is intentional

suppressedMessages.message:
Error: Cannot access refs during render

React refs are values that are not needed for rendering. Refs should only be accessed outside of render, such as in event handlers or effects. Accessing a ref value (the `current` property) during render can cause your component not to update as expected (https://react.dev/reference/react/useRef).

C:\Users\silve\Downloads\GitHub\roadtrip-planner\src\components\UI\Button.tsx:24:40
  22 |       const child = children as React.ReactElement<Record<string, unknown>>;
  23 |       // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/refs -- forwardRef intentionally uses ref during render
> 24 |       return React.cloneElement(child, {
     |                                        ^
> 25 |         ...props,
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 26 |         ref,
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 27 |         className: cn(buttonVariants({ variant, size, className }), child.props.className as string),
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 28 |       } as Record<string, unknown>);
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Passing a ref to a function may read its value during render
  29 |     }
  30 |
  31 |     return (

suppressions.justification: forwardRef intentionally uses ref during render

suppressedMessages.message:
Error: Cannot access refs during render

React refs are values that are not needed for rendering. Refs should only be accessed outside of render, such as in event handlers or effects. Accessing a ref value (the `current` property) during render can cause your component not to update as expected (https://react.dev/reference/react/useRef).

> 31 |       return React.cloneElement(child, {
     |                                        ^
> 32 |         ...props,
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 33 |         ref,
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 34 |         className: cn("peer", child.props.className as string),
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> 35 |       } as Record<string, unknown>);
     | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Passing a ref to a function may read its value during render
  36 |     }
  37 |     return (
  38 |       <span ref={ref as React.Ref<HTMLSpanElement>} className="peer" {...props}>

suppressions.justification: forwardRef intentionally uses ref during render

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useEffect has a missing dependency: 'setVehicle'. Either include it or remove the dependency array. If 'setVehicle' changes too often, find the parent component that defines it and wrap that definition in useCallback.

suggestions.desc: Update the dependencies array to be: [setVehicle]

suppressions.justification: empty dep array is intentional; setVehicle is stable

suppressedMessages.message: React Hook useEffect has missing dependencies: 'forceStep', 'markStepComplete', 'setAdaptiveDefaults', 'setLocations', 'setSettings', and 'setVehicle'. Either include them or remove the dependency array. If 'setLocations' changes too often, find the parent component that defines it and wrap that definition in useCallback.
